1.text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham.

2.text: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob: and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

3.text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

4.text: And Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;

5.text: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Rath; and Obed begat Jesse;

6.text: And Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of her of Urias.

7.text: And Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;

8.text: And Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

9.text: And Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz; begat Ezekias;

10.text: And Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;

11.text: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren upon the transferring of Babylon.

12.text: And after the transferring of Babylon Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

13.text: And Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

14.text: And Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim beget Elind;

15.text: And Elind begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

16.text: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, being called Christ, the anointed.

17.text: Therefore all the generations from Abraham to David, fourteen generations; and from David to the transferring of Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the transferring of Babylon to Christ, fourteen generations.

18.text: And the generation of Jesus Christ was thus: for Mary his mother having been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together she was found with child by the Holy Ghost.

19.text: And Joseph her husband being just, and not willing to expose her to disgrace, wished to let her go in secret.

20.text: And reflecting upon these things, behold a messenger of the Lord appeared to him saying, Joseph, thou son of David, thou shouldest not fear to take to thyself Mary thy wife: for that begotten in her is of the Holy Spirit.

21.text: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus; for he shall save his people from their sins,

22.text: And the whole of this has been that it might be completed having been spoken by the prophet, saying,

23.text: Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which is, being interpreted, God with us.

24.text: And Joseph having awaked from sleep, did as the messenger of the Lord commanded him:

25.text: And he took to himself his wife, and knew her not till she brought forth her first born son: and be called his name Jesus.
